page.title: 03GLENLIVET RECEPTION CENTRE
page.content: Whilst waiting for guided tours round the distillery, tourists visit the shop and reception centre which was opened in 1978. The building itself was the redundant malting shed, and implements used can be seen alongside cooper's tools, old photographs and documents. The polished wooden floor reflects copper jugs, brass spirit safes and a small fire engine. The Landseer painting 'Highland Whisky Still' is recreated as a life size tableau with genuine illicit stills, highland dress, stuffed deer, grouse and dogs. In complete contrast is a video showing the making and marketing of The Glenlivet Whisky. At the bar visitors receive a tot of whisky. From May to October 14 people are employed to guide approximately fifty thousand visitors through the distillery.
